content:
As a beginner, synthetic brushes are an excellent choice. They're more affordable, easy to care for, and can still produce great results. Plus, they're a great way to get started with watercolor without breaking the bank.

It's fantastic that you've been taking an online watercolor class since January 15th! Consistency is key when it comes to improving your skills. How's your experience been so far? What do you think has been the most challenging part of learning watercolor for you?

Remember, practice is key, and don't be too hard on yourself if your early attempts don't turn out as expected. Watercolor can be a bit unpredictable, but that's also part of its charm!

If you don't mind me asking, what inspired you to take up watercolor painting? Is there a particular style or artist that you're drawn to?

Keep practicing, and most importantly, have fun!
